nodes.name: Definition of connectedSubgoal*
nodes.fol: (forall (a e2 e1 s1 s2) (iff (connectedSubgoal* e2 e1 a s1 s2) (or (and (equal e1 e2)(member e1 s1)) (exists (e3 r) (and (member e3 s1)(subgoal e3 e1) (subgoal' r e3 e1)(member r s2) (connectedSubgoal* e2 e3 a s1 s2))))))
nodes.english: e2 is a connected subgoal* of e1 for agent a with respect to set s1 of eventualities and set s2 of subgoal relations, if e2 and e1 are identical and in s1, or if there is a subgoal e3 of e1 for a in s1 whose subgoal relation r is in set s2, and e2 is a connected subgoal* of e3 for a with respect to sets s1 and s2.

nodes.name: Definition of plan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a e) (iff (plan p a e) (exists (s1 s2) (and (compositeEntity p) (componentsOf s1 p)(relationsOf s2 p) (member e s1) (forall (e1) (if (member e1 s1) (connectedSubgoal* e1 e a s1 s2))) (forall (r) (if (member r s2) (exists (e2 e3) (and (member e2 s1)(member e3 s1) (subgoal' r e2 e3)))))))))
nodes.english: p is a plan by agent a to bring about eventuality e exactly when p is a composite entity whose components are subgoals of e (or subgoals of subgoals, etc.), and whose relations are subgoal relations between pairs of elements in s1.

nodes.name: Definition of subgoalIn
nodes.fol: (forall (p e1) (iff (subgoalIn e1 p) (exists (a e s) (and (plan p a e)(componentsOf s p)(member e1 s)))))
nodes.english: Eventuality e1 is a subgoal in plan p if there exists an agent a and goal e such that p is a plan by a for e, and e1 is a component of p.

nodes.name: Definition of subgoalsOf
nodes.fol: (forall (s p) (iff (subgoalsOf s p) (exists (a g) (and (plan p a g)(componentsOf s p)))))
nodes.english: Set s is the set of subgoals of plan p if there exists an agent a and goal g such that p is a plan by a for g, and s are the components of p.

nodes.name: Definition of subplan
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 p) (iff (subplan p1 p) (exists (a e e1 s1 s2 s3 s4) (and (plan p a e)(plan p1 a e1) (componentsOf s1 p)(componentsOf s2 p1) (subset s2 s1) (relationsOf s3 p)(relationsOf s4 p1) (subset s4 s3)))))
nodes.english: Plan p1 is a subplan of plan p if both are plans by the same agent, and the components and relations of p1 are subsets of those of p.

nodes.name: Definition of planseq
nodes.fol: (forall (s a e) (iff (planseq s a e) (exists (n) (and (sequence s)(length n s) (forall (i1 i2 p1 p2) (if (and (posInteger i1)(successor i2 i1) (lt i1 n)(nth p1 i1 s)(nth p2 i2 s)) (exists (e1 e2) (and (plan' e1 p1 a e)(plan' e2 p2 a e) (change e1 e2)))))))))
nodes.english: A plan sequence is a sequence of plans where there has been a change from each element of the sequence being a's plan to achieve e to the next element in the sequence being a's plan to achieve e.

nodes.name: Subgoal relation based on causal belief
nodes.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 p g) (if (and (subgoal e2 e1)(subgoalIn e1 p)(subgoalIn e2 p)(plan p a g)) (exists (e) (and (believe a e)(causallyInvolved' e e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: Two eventualities come to be in a subgoal relation because the agent believes there is a causal or enablement relation between them.

nodes.name: Plan as envisioned causal system
nodes.fol: (forall (p a e) (if (plan p a e)(ecs p a)))
nodes.english: A plan can be thought of as an envisioned causal system.

nodes.name: Planning as variety of envisioning
nodes.fol: (forall (s a e) (if (planseq s a e)(ecsSeq s a)))
nodes.english: Planning is a variety of envisioning.

nodes.name: Definition of desire
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (if (desire a e) (exists (e0 e1) (and (believe a e1)(causallyInvolved' e1 e e0) (thrive' e0 a)))))
nodes.english: If agent a desires a state or event e, then a believes e plays a causal role in a's thriving.

nodes.name: Definition of thePlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a) (if (thePlan p a) (exists (e) (and (plan p a e)(thrive' e a)))))
nodes.english: The Plan is a plan to thrive.

nodes.name: Actions caused by being in thePlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a e1) (if (and (thePlan p a)(agentOf a e1)(Rexist e1)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (subgoalIn' e2 e1 p)(cause e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: Actions e1 of a's that really occur are defeasibly caused by a's having the action as a subgoal in the Plan.

nodes.name: Definition of thePlanseq
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (iff (thePlanseq s a) (and (planseq s a e0)(thrive' e0 a) (forall (p i) (iff (nth p i s) (exists (e t) (and (thePlan' e p a)(atTime e t))))))))
nodes.english: A plan p is in the Plan sequence of agent a if and only if there is some time t at which p was the Plan of a's.

nodes.name: Definition of intend
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (intend a e) (exists (p) (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn e p)(agentOf a e)))))
nodes.english: An intention is a subgoal in the Plan of an agent that is an action by the agent.

nodes.name: Definition of decideTo for eventualities
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (if (eventuality e) (iff (decideTo a e) (exists (e1) (and (changeTo e1)(subgoalIn' e1 e p) (thePlan p a))))))
nodes.english: To decide to do something is to effect a change of state from one in which that something is not a goal in the Plan to one in which it is.

nodes.name: Definition of decideTo for plans
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 a g) (if (plan p1 a g) (iff (decideTo a p1) (exists (p e1) (and (changeTo e1)(subplan' e1 p1 p) (thePlan p a))))))
nodes.english: We can also decide to execute entire plans.

nodes.name: Definition of planTo
nodes.fol: (forall (g a p s) (if (and (goal g a)(planseq s a g)(last p s) (decideTo a p)) (planTo a g p)))
nodes.english: If agent a has goal g, a envisions a plan sequence s for achieving g, plan p is the last element in the sequence s, and a decides to add p as a subplan of thePlan, then a plans to achieve g by means of plan p.

nodes.name: Constraint on will - agent
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (if (will a e)(agent a)))
nodes.english: The constraint on the first argument of will is that it is an agent.

nodes.name: Constraint on will - agentOf
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (if (will a e)(agentOf a e)))
nodes.english: The only constraint we will stipulate here is that a must be the agent of e.

nodes.name: Will causes direct causation
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 a e) (if (and (will' e1 a e)(cause e1 e))(dcause e1 e)))
nodes.english: If agent a wills e and e actually occurs as a result, then the willing has directly caused e, that is, there are no intermediate eventualities in the causal chain initiated by the willing.

nodes.name: Will based on intention
nodes.fol: (forall (a e p) (if (and (thePlan p a)(will a e))(subgoalIn e p)))
nodes.english: Generally, when someone wills to do something, it is because he or she intends to do it. That is, the action is the next action in thePlan.

nodes.name: Plan causally involved in action
nodes.fol: (forall (p a e0 e e1 c) (if (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn' e0 e p)(agentOf a e) (will' e1 a e)(possible e1 c)(etc)) (causallyInvolved e0 e)))
nodes.english: If some action by the agent is in the Plan, it is possible for a to will the action, and the action occurs, then defeasibly its being in the plan is causally involved in the occurrence.

nodes.name: Definition of strategy
nodes.fol: (forall (p e) (if (strategy p e) (exists (a s) (and (plan p a e)(parameters s e)(not (null s))))))
nodes.english: A rather weak constraint on a strategy is that it is a plan whose top-level goal is an eventuality type.

nodes.name: Definition of tactic
nodes.fol: (forall (p e) (if (tactic p e) (exists (a s) (and (plan p a e)(parameters s e)(not (null s))))))
nodes.english: A tactic is also some agent's general plan.

nodes.name: Strategy not subplan of tactic
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 e1 p2 e2) (if (and (strategy p1 e1)(tactic p2 e2)) (not (subplan p1 p2))))
nodes.english: A strategy is not a subplan of a tactic. Strategies can contain tactics, but tactics do not contain strategies.

nodes.name: Tactic as subplan of strategy
nodes.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (tactic p e)(etc)) (exists (p1) (and (strategy p1 e1)(subplan p p1)))))
nodes.english: A stronger rule would be that a tactic has some strategic goal it is ultimately in the service of, so we can say that if something is a tactic, it is the subplan of some strategy.

nodes.name: Definition of executable1
nodes.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (executable1 e a c t) (or (executable e a c t) (atTime e t) (exists (b) (and (agent b)(committed b e) (executable e b c t))) (forall (e1) (if (subgoal e1 e)(executable1 e1 a c t))))))
nodes.english: Event e is executable1 by agent a given constraints c if it is executable by a, or if it will happen anyway, or if some other agent b is committed to making sure e occurs, or if its subgoals are all executable1.

nodes.name: Committed agents cause events
nodes.fol: (forall (a e e1) (if (and (committed a e1)(atTime' e1 e t)(agentOf a e)(etc)) (atTime e t)))
nodes.english: Its principal property is that if someone is committed to an event occurring and is the agent of that event, then defeasibly that event will occur.

nodes.name: Definition of completePlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a e c) (iff (completePlan p a e c) (exists (t) (and (Now t)(executable1 e a c t)))))
nodes.english: A plan is complete when its top-level goal is executable1 now (given constraints c).

nodes.name: Definition of partialPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a e c) (iff (partialPlan p a e c) (and (plan p a e)(not (completePlan p a e c)))))
nodes.english: A partial plan is a plan that is not complete.

nodes.name: Definition of planInstance
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 p) (iff (planInstance p1 p) (exists (a g) (and (plan p a g)(instance p1 p)))))
nodes.english: A plan instance is created by substituting values for parameters in a plan type.

nodes.name: Definition of planInstancePlus
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 p) (iff (planInstancePlus p1 p) (exists (a g p0) (and (plan p1 a g)(plan p0 a g)(planInstance p0 p) (subplan p0 p1)))))
nodes.english: A planInstancePlus is a plan instance that has possibly been extended by elaborating some of the subgoals into subplans for achieving them.

nodes.name: Normal plan is a plan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (if (normalPlan p a g) (plan p a g)))
nodes.english: A normal plan is a plan.

nodes.name: Definition of adversarialPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 a1 a g1) (iff (adversarialPlan p1 a1 a g1) (exists (p g) (and (nequal a a1)(plan p a g)(plan p1 a1 g1) (not' g1 g)))))
nodes.english: p1 is an adversarial plan by agent a1 to achieve goal g1 which is the negation of a goal g another agent a is trying to achieve.

nodes.name: Definition of counterplan
nodes.fol: (forall (p2 p1 a a1 g1) (iff (counterplan p2 p1 a a1 g1) (exists (e1 e2) (and (nequal a a1)(adversarialPlan p1 a1 a g1) (cause' e1 p1 g1)(not' e2 e1) (plan p2 a e2)))))
nodes.english: Here p1 is an adversarial plan of agent a1's to block agent a's goal. Plan p2 is a counterplan by agent a to block plan p1 of a1's.

nodes.name: Definition of competitiveGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (g a1 a2) (iff (competitiveGoal g a1 a2) (exists (g1 g2) (and (nequal a1 a2)(instance g1 g)(instance g2 g) (goal g1 a1)(goal g2 a2) (inconsistent g1 g2)))))
nodes.english: A competitive goal is one that can be instantiated for each of the competing agents, but it cannot hold for both agents.

nodes.name: Definition of competitivePlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a1 a2 g) (iff (competitivePlan p a1 a2 g) (exists (g1) (and (plan p a1 g1)(instance g1 g) (competitiveGoal g a1 a2)))))
nodes.english: A competitive plan is a plan that is aimed at achieving a competitive goal.

nodes.name: Definition of assistivePlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a a1 g) (iff (assistivePlan p a a1 g) (exists (e e1) (and (nequal a a1)(goal' e g a)(goal' e1 g a1) (cause e1 e)(plan p a g)))))
nodes.english: Here e is the eventuality of g's being a goal of a's, e1 is the eventuality of g's being a goal of a1's, and the latter causes the former. That is, agent a has adopted the goal g precisely because it was a goal of agent a1's.

nodes.name: Definition of sharedPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p s g) (iff (sharedPlan p s g) (and (forall (a)(if (member a s)(agent a))) (goal g s)(plan p s g) (forall (e g1 g2) (if (and (subgoal' e g1 g2)(subgoalIn g1 p) (subgoalIn g2 p)(etc)) (mb s e))) (forall (a e) (if (and (member a s)(subgoalIn e p)(arg* a e)) (committed a e))))))
nodes.english: p is a shared plan by a group s of agents to achieve goal g. All members of s are agents, the group has g as a goal and p is a plan for achieving the goal, the members of s mutually believe in the structure of the plan, and the members of s are committed to performing their parts in the plan.

nodes.name: Definition of envisionedPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a a1 g) (iff (envisionedPlan p a a1 g) (and (plan p a g)(ecs p a1))))
nodes.english: An envisioned plan is a plan that is envisioned by another agent. A plan is a causal system, and the expression (ecs p a1) says that p is a causal system envisioned by agent a1.

nodes.name: Definition of unknownPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a a1 g) (iff (unknownPlan p a a1 g) (and (plan p a g)(nequal a a1)(not (know a1 p)))))
nodes.english: An unknown plan is a plan by one agent that is not known by another agent.

nodes.name: Definition of nonconsciousPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (nonconsciousPlan p a g) (and (plan p a g)(not (know a p)))))
nodes.english: A nonconscious plan is one that is not known to the planning agent himself or herself.

nodes.name: Definition of do with goal causation
nodes.fol: (forall (a e) (if (and (do a e)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (arg* a e)(Rexist e)(goal' e1 e a)(cause e1 e)))))
nodes.english: Here e really happens. Eventuality e1 is e's being a goal of a's, and e1 causes e.

nodes.name: Definition of do for plans
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (if (plan p a g) (iff (do a p) (forall (e) (if (and (subgoalIn e p)(arg* a e))(do a e))))))
nodes.english: Because a plan is a structured set of eventualities, we can also speak of plans being executed, or done.

nodes.name: Definition of reusedPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (reusedPlan p a g) (exists (p1 p2) (and (planInstancePlus p1 p)(planInstancePlus p2 p) (nequal p1 p2)(do a p1)(do a p2)))))
nodes.english: If these instances are actually executed, we can call the plan a 'reused plan.'

nodes.name: Occasional plans are reused
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (if (occasionalPlan p a g)(reusedPlan p a g)))
nodes.english: Both occasional and repeated plans are reused plans.

nodes.name: Repeated plans are reused
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (if (repeatedPlan p a g)(reusedPlan p a g)))
nodes.english: Both occasional and repeated plans are reused plans.

nodes.name: Definition of periodicPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (periodicPlan p a g) (exists (s) (and (reusedPlan p a g) (forall (p1) (iff (member p1 s)(planInstancePlus p1 p))) (periodicTseq s)))))
nodes.english: p is a periodic plan if its instantiations constitute a periodic temporal sequence.

nodes.name: Definition of continuousPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g t) (iff (continuousPlan p a g t) (exists (e)(and (do' e a p)(timeSpanOf t e) (interval t)))))
nodes.english: A plan that is continuous over interval t is one whose execution has a time span of t.

nodes.name: Definition of help0
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (help0 e1 e2)(causallyInvolved e1 e2)))
nodes.english: The simplest notion of 'help' is that one event helps another event to happen if it is in its causal complex.

nodes.name: Definition of help1
nodes.fol: (forall (a a1 e) (iff (help1 a a1 e) (exists (e1) (and (goal e a1)(causallyInvolved e1 e)(do a e1)))))
nodes.english: Agent a helps agent a1 achieve a1's goal e if a does something e1 that is in the causal complex for e. Note that a and a1 need not be distinct, as you can help yourself.

nodes.name: Definition of help2
nodes.fol: (forall (a a1 e) (iff (help2 a a1 e) (exists (e1 e2) (and (goal' e2 e a1)(causallyInvolved e1 e) (do a e1)(cause e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: Here e2 is the condition of e being a goal of a1's, and it functions as a cause of a's doing e1. Because you want (e2) to live (e), I'll take your keys away (e1). I've thereby helped you continue to live.

nodes.name: Definition of help3
nodes.fol: (forall (a a1 e) (iff (help3 a a1 e) (exists (p s e1) (and (sharedPlan p s e)(doubleton s a a1)(goal e a1) (subgoalIn e1 p)(arg* a e1)))))
nodes.english: Here p is the shared plan by agents a and a1 to achieve a1's goal e, and e1 is a subgoal in that plan that a plays a role in.

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
